description: To define a CodeSystem the keyword CodeSystem is required, and
Id, Description, Title are optional but recommended.
CodeSystem is used to define new codes inside an IG that are not drawn from an external code system.
For more information look at the HL7 FHIR Shorthand language reference.
To define an extension, the keyword Extension is required,
Parent is optional and Id, Description, Title are also optional but recommended.
For more information look at the HL7 FHIR Shorthand language reference.
To define an instance the keywords Instance and InstanceOf are required, and
Description, Title are optional but recommended and Usage is optional.
Assignment rules are used to set additional values.
For more information look at the HL7 FHIR Shorthand language reference.
To define an invariant the keywords Invariant, Description and Severity, and
XPath and Expression are optional.
Invariant definition cannot have rules and are are incorporated into a profile via obeys rules.
For more information look at the HL7 FHIR Shorthand language reference.
To define a Mapping the keywords Mapping, Source and Target are required, and
Description and Title are optional but recommended.
Mapping are intended to help implementers understand the SD in relation to other standards..
For more information look at the HL7 FHIR Shorthand language reference.
To define a profile, the keyword Profile and Parent are required, and
Id, Title and Description are optional but recommended.
Rules defining the profile follow immediately after the keyword section.
For more information look at the HL7 FHIR Shorthand language reference.
To define a RuleSet the keyword RuleSet is required.
Rule sets provide the ability to define a group rules as an independent entity.
Through insert rules, they can be incorporated into a compatible target.
For more information look at the HL7 FHIR Shorthand language reference.
To define a RuleSet the keyword RuleSet is required.
Rule sets provide the ability to define a group rules as an independent entity.
Through insert rules, they can be incorporated into a compatible target.
For more information look at the HL7 FHIR Shorthand language reference.
To define a valueSet the keyword ValueSet is required, and
Id, Description and Title are optional but recommended.
A value set is a group of coded values representing acceptable values for a FHIR element whose data type is code.
The contents of a value set are defined by a set of rules.
For more information look at the HL7 FHIR Shorthand language reference.
